Flexbox: Frogs on a Log

Each card is a different Flexbox setting. The brown plank is the log (flex container). The green circles are frogs (flex items).

justify-content (along the log)

justify-content: flex-start
1
2
3
flex-start → frogs huddle at the left end of the log.
justify-content: center
1
2
3
center → frogs gather in the middle of the log.
justify-content: flex-end
1
2
3
flex-end → frogs scoot to the right end.
justify-content: space-between
1
2
3
space-between → first and last frog guard the ends, middle frog stays centered.
justify-content: space-around
1
2
3
space-around → equal bubbles of space around each frog (edge space is half).
justify-content: space-evenly
1
2
3
space-evenly → perfectly even spaces, including edges.

align-items (across the log)

align-items: flex-start
1
2
3
flex-start → frogs perch along the top of the log.
align-items: center
1
2
3
center → frogs sit centered vertically.
align-items: flex-end
1
2
3
flex-end → frogs line up along the bottom of the log.
align-items: stretch
stretch (default if heights aren’t set) → frogs stretch to fill the log’s height.
align-items: baseline
1
2
3
baseline → frogs line up where their text baselines match.

flex (who gets more of the log?)

default (no flex growth)
1
2
3
No flex → each frog keeps its own size; extra log space stays empty.
1 : 1 : 1
1
2
3
flex: 1 on all frogs → they share the log equally.
2 : 1 : 1
1
2
3
flex: 2 on Frog 1 → that frog gets twice as much log as the others.
1 : 2 : 3
1
2
3
Different flex ratios → frogs divvy up the log by their numbers.

Tip: Toggle flex-direction: column on any .log in DevTools to flip the log upright — now justify-content runs top↕bottom, and align-items runs left↔right.
